page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: There are three schools in Campden, St Catharine's R.C.Primary, St James C of E Primary and the secondary Chipping Campden School. The first two schools are "aided" which means that the State provides the teachers' salaries and an allowance for the children's books and apparatus but the Governors provide and maintain the buildings. Primary schools accept children from the age of 5 years. At 11 years they attend Campden School and are educated until they are 16 or beyond if they are sitting A level exams. Campden School is large with 800 pupils and 50 teachers.It is comprehensive and takes all children from a wide area, regardless of abilities.St James is an old Campden school with new premises, St Catharine's and Campden School were modernised and added to. About 1000 pupils attend the schools in Campden.
